name: SRTools
short_description:
Sometimes after downloading a movie from a torrent tracker you may face the situation when FFmpeg or Mencoder refuse to recode/remux it because of corrupted subtitles (non-successive timecodes, wrong indexes and such) or you plan to use subtitles from another rip (with a better translation, for example), but it has a different duration, so you need to shift all timestamps.
Another case: you may want to convert cluttered SSA/ASS subtitles to plain SRT format.
These little scripts, written in Ruby, are here to solve all those tasks.
summary: Tools for working with SubRip subtitles
